intro: Banksia rufa subsp. rufa, commonly known as the red banksia, is a shrub or small tree native to southwestern Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical flower spikes, which are typically orange to red in color. The plant produces woody follicles that contain seeds, which are released after the follicles dry and split open. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Banksia rufa subsp. rufa is an important plant in the ecological landscape, providing habitat and food for various native wildlife species.
